headline: Salesforce and Other AI Stocks That Can Catch Up to the Pack
summary: Nvidia Microsoft  and other prominent artificial-intelligence stocks are seeing bouts of selling.  Wall Street has grown wary that software and internet companies will slow down the pace of their investments in data centers, dragging down chip stocks.  The worry there is that returns on their massive AI investments might disappoint the market’s expectations.

headline: How to trade cash-secured puts: Options playbook
summary: Want to broaden your investor playbook, but don't know how or where to start? Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre explains a specific segment of options trading: cash-secured puts. Using Microsoft (MSFT) as an example, Jared Blikre lays out the risks and benefits of cash-secured puts and weighs the maximum profit against the net cost of the stock put. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

Want to broaden your investor playbook, but don't know how or where to start? Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre explains a specific segment of options trading: cash-secured puts.

headline: Amazon Names New AI Chief Amid Battle to Take on Tech Rivals
summary: Peter DeSantis will lead the new group, Amazon Chief Executive Officer Andy Jassy said Wednesday in a message to employees, which was also posted on the company’s corporate blog.  The new organization will combine Amazon’s Artificial General Intelligence team — which oversees the company’s Nova-branded AI models and the digital brains of the Alexa voice assistant — with Amazon’s chipmaking unit and quantum computing research.

content.title: Amazon Names New AI Chief Amid Battle to Take on Tech Rivals
content.summary: Peter DeSantis will lead the new group, Amazon Chief Executive Officer Andy Jassy said Wednesday in a message to employees, which was also posted on the company’s corporate blog.  The new organization will combine Amazon’s Artificial General Intelligence team — which oversees the company’s Nova-branded AI models and the digital brains of the Alexa voice assistant — with Amazon’s chipmaking unit and quantum computing research.

headline: Amazon shakes up AI team as veteran Prasad leaves, DeSantis promoted
summary: Amazon is shaking up its artificial intelligence team with one long-time veteran heading for the exit and another ​taking over a more expansive group that includes AI models, custom silicon ‌and quantum computing.  The move comes just two weeks after the Amazon Web Services annual cloud computing conference ‌in Las Vegas, which the company has turned into a showcase for AI tools and services.  Amazon has been working to shake a reputation that it is trailing competitors like Google, Microsoft and OpenAI in developing AI models.

content.title: Amazon shakes up AI team as veteran Prasad leaves, DeSantis promoted
content.summary: Amazon is shaking up its artificial intelligence team with one long-time veteran heading for the exit and another ​taking over a more expansive group that includes AI models, custom silicon ‌and quantum computing.  The move comes just two weeks after the Amazon Web Services annual cloud computing conference ‌in Las Vegas, which the company has turned into a showcase for AI tools and services.  Amazon has been working to shake a reputation that it is trailing competitors like Google, Microsoft and OpenAI in developing AI models.

headline: Google teams with Meta’s PyTorch to chip away at Nvidia’s moat, Reuters says
summary: Investing.com -- Alphabet Inc’s (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google is intensifying efforts to make its proprietary artificial intelligence hardware more compatible with the industry’s leading software, a move aimed at challenging NVIDIA Corp’s (NASDAQ:NVDA) grip on the AI computing market, Reuters reported Wednesday. The initiative, known internally as "TorchTPU," focuses on optimizing Google’s Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) to run PyTorch, an open-source framework originally developed by Meta Platforms Inc.

content.title: Google teams with Meta’s PyTorch to chip away at Nvidia’s moat, Reuters says
content.summary: Investing.com -- Alphabet Inc’s (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google is intensifying efforts to make its proprietary artificial intelligence hardware more compatible with the industry’s leading software, a move aimed at challenging NVIDIA Corp’s (NASDAQ:NVDA) grip on the AI computing market, Reuters reported Wednesday. The initiative, known internally as "TorchTPU," focuses on optimizing Google’s Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) to run PyTorch, an open-source framework originally developed by Meta Platforms Inc.

headline: PairSoft Announces Majority Growth Investment from TA
summary: BOSTON, December 17, 2025--PairSoft, a leading provider of procure-to-pay automation and payment solutions, today announced a majority investment from TA Associates ("TA"), a leading global private equity firm. The partnership will support PairSoft’s continued product enhancement, innovation and global expansion. As a result of the transaction, existing investor Turn/River Capital will fully exit its stake in the business.

content.title: PairSoft Announces Majority Growth Investment from TA
content.summary: BOSTON, December 17, 2025--PairSoft, a leading provider of procure-to-pay automation and payment solutions, today announced a majority investment from TA Associates ("TA"), a leading global private equity firm. The partnership will support PairSoft’s continued product enhancement, innovation and global expansion. As a result of the transaction, existing investor Turn/River Capital will fully exit its stake in the business.

headline: Broadwing Capital Launches IT Managed Services Platform with CloudScale365 Acquisition
summary: Broadwing Capital, the Dallas-based private equity firm specializing in the lower middle-market manufacturing and services sectors, today announced its acquisition of CloudScale365, the first investment in its new IT Managed Service Provider (MSP) platform. CloudScale365 is a leading provider of managed IT, cloud, hosting, and security solutions for small and medium-sized businesses.

headline: Concentric AI Introduces Private Scan Manager for Azure to Enable Compliance and Comprehensive GenAI Data Security for Highly Regulated Organizations
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., December 17, 2025--Concentric AI today announced expanded Private Scan Manager functionality in its Semantic Intelligence™ data security governance platform. Customers now have the ability to deploy Semantic Intelligence within their own private Microsoft Azure cloud. This follows an announcement earlier this year where Concentric AI announced support for private scanning in AWS environments, and gives customers the choice of deploying in either private cloud environment.

content.title: Concentric AI Introduces Private Scan Manager for Azure to Enable Compliance and Comprehensive GenAI Data Security for Highly Regulated Organizations
content.summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., December 17, 2025--Concentric AI today announced expanded Private Scan Manager functionality in its Semantic Intelligence™ data security governance platform. Customers now have the ability to deploy Semantic Intelligence within their own private Microsoft Azure cloud. This follows an announcement earlier this year where Concentric AI announced support for private scanning in AWS environments, and gives customers the choice of deploying in either private cloud environment.

headline: Analysis-Qatar bets on cheap power to catch up in Gulf AI race
summary: DUBAI, Dec 17 (Reuters) - Qatar is banking on its abundant, low-cost energy to make up for lost time in the Gulf's artificial intelligence race, hoping that cheap power and deep pockets will help it catch up with regional rivals that have already secured ​a head start. The launch of Qai, backed by the country's $526 billion sovereign wealth fund and a $20 billion joint venture with Brookfield, marks Qatar's most ambitious move ‌yet into a sector that is reshaping global technology and economics

content.title: Analysis-Qatar bets on cheap power to catch up in Gulf AI race

The launch of Qai, backed by the country's $526 billion sovereign wealth fund and a $20 billion joint venture with Brookfield, marks Qatar's most ambitious move ‌yet into a sector that is reshaping global technology and economics
